abstract.p: Ugandan police arrest Kizza Besigye, main opposition politician, on charges of treason; thousands riot in Kampala in response; photo (S)

block.p: The police arrested the country's main opposition politician, Kizza Besigye, left, on charges of treason, prompting thousands of supporters to riot in Kampala, the capital. Mr. Besigye, who unsuccessfully challenged President Yoweri Museveni in 2001 and went into exile in South Africa immediately afterward, returned to Uganda amid much fanfare last month. A fierce critic of Mr. Museveni, whom he condemns as a dictator, Mr. Besigye is accused by prosecutors of having links to two rebels groups seeking the violent overthrow of the government.
